election_record.label: Massachusetts 1816 Governor

sub_unit.name: Truro
sub_unit.note: "Rejected". Original Election Returns.
"That they have rejected the return of votes from the town of Truro, in the county of Barnstable it having been signed by but one Selectman." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 13, 1816.

sub_unit.name: Clarksburg
sub_unit.note: The votes from Clarksburg were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Standish
sub_unit.note: John Brooks received 1 vote as General John Brooks.

sub_unit.name: Leyden
sub_unit.note: Leyden Town Records. 100, list 63 votes for John Brooks in Leyden.

sub_unit.name: Holland
sub_unit.note: The votes from Holland were rejected.

"That they have rejected the return of votes from the town of Holland, in the county of Hampden, the said return not have been attested by the Town Clerk." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 13, 1816.

sub_unit.name: South Hadley
sub_unit.note: The votes from South Hadley were rejected.

"That after the examination they have rejected the return of votes from the town of South Hadley, in the county of Hampshire, it bearing the signature of three persons, but it not appearing that they signed the return as Selectmen." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 13, 1816.

sub_unit.name: Penobscot
sub_unit.note: The votes from Penobscot were rejected.

"That they have rejected the return of votes from the town of Penobscot, in the county of Hancock, it not appearing by the return that the voters were qualified to vote for Governor and Lieutenant Governor." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 13, 1816.

sub_unit.name: Temple
sub_unit.note: The votes from Temple were rejected.
"No return." Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Montville Plantation
sub_unit.note: Montville Plantation also known as Davistown.

sub_unit.name: Stow
sub_unit.note: "Rejected". Original Election Returns.

"That they have rejected the return of votes from the town of Stow in the county of Middlesex, the said return not having been attested by the Town Clerk." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 13, 1816.

sub_unit.name: Holmanstown
sub_unit.note: Holmanstown is listed as a Plantation in the Original Election returns.

sub_unit.name: Thompson Pond Plantation
sub_unit.note: Thompson Pond also known as Lunt's Grant.

sub_unit.name: Wareham
sub_unit.note: "Rejected." Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: New Portland
sub_unit.note: The votes from New Portland were rejected.

"That they have rejected the return of votes from the town of New Portland, in the county of Somerset, it not appearing when or where the meeting was held nor who were assembled." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 13, 1816.

sub_unit.name: Addison
sub_unit.note: The votes from Addison were rejected.

"That they have rejected the return of votes from the town of Addison, in the county of Washington, it not appearing when or where the meeting was held, nor who were assembled." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 13, 1816.

sub_unit.name: Calais
sub_unit.note: "Return too late." Original Election Returns.

"That they have rejected the return of votes from the town of Calais, in the county of Washington, it having been returned to the Secretary's office after the 13th day of May current." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 13, 1816.

sub_unit.name: Eastport
sub_unit.note: The votes from Eastport were rejected.
"No Return." Original Election Returns.
Eastport was under British control from July 11, 1814 until June 30, 1818.

Boston Daily Advertiser (Boston, MA) April 6, 1816: "The town of Eastport, it seems, has given its votes for governor, viz: .... We presume however they will not be received, the town at present not forming a part of the commonwealth."

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. Massachusetts State Archives, Boston.
